source_sentence: 佛說九色鹿經
translation: Foshuo nine-colored deer jing

source_sentence: 吳月氏優婆塞支謙譯
translation: Wu Yuezhi Upāsaka, translated by Zhi Qian

source_sentence: 佛言：「昔者，菩薩身為九色鹿；
translation: The Buddha said: Formerly the bodhisattva’s body was that of a deer of nine colors.

source_sentence: 其毛九種色，其角白如雪，常在恒水邊飲食水草，常與一烏為知識。
translation: Its hair was of nine colors and its horns were white like snow. It always fed on water and grass at the edge of the Ganges River and always gave it to a crow as a friend.

source_sentence: 「時，水中有溺人隨流來下，或出或沒，得著樹木，仰頭呼天：『山神、樹神、諸天龍神，
translation: “At that time, there was a drowning man in the water who came down and went along with the river. Some of the gods emerged or disappeared, clinging to trees and bodhisattvas, raising their heads to call out to the

source_sentence: 何不愍傷我也？』
translation: Why don't you pity me?'

source_sentence: 鹿聞人喚聲，即走往水邊，語溺人言：『汝可勿怖！
translation: When the deer heard the sound of the call, it ran to the edge of the water and said to the drowning man, 'Don't be afraid!'

source_sentence: 汝可騎我背、捉我角，我相負出上岸。』
translation: You may ride on my back and grasp my horns, and I'll carry you up to the shore.'

source_sentence: 「鹿大疲極，溺人下地，繞鹿三匝，向鹿叩頭，乞為大家作奴，給其使令採取水草。
translation: The deer was greatly exhausted and sank down to the ground, circled the deer three times, bowed his head in respect toward it, begged him to become a slave for the community, and gave him an envoy to gather water and grass.

source_sentence: 鹿言：『不用卿也，且各自去，欲報恩者，莫得道我在此間，人貪我皮角，
translation: The deer said, “No need to tell me where I am. People will covet my skin and horns.

source_sentence: 必來殺我。』
translation: They'll surely come and kill me.'

source_sentence: 於是，溺者受教而去。
translation: The drowning man then accepted the teaching and departed.

source_sentence: 「爾時，國王夫人夜夢見九色鹿，意欲得其皮角，即託病不起。
translation: At the time, the king's wife dreamt that she saw a nine-colored deer in a night and wanted to get its skin and horns, so she didn't become ill.

source_sentence: 王問夫人言：『何以不起？』
translation: The king asked the lady, 'Why don't you get up?'

source_sentence: 「夫人答言：『昨夜夢見非常鹿，其毛九種色，其角白如雪，我思得其皮作衣裘、其角作拂柄，
translation: The queen replied, “Last night I dreamt of an extraordinary deer whose hairs are of nine colors and whose horns are as white as snow.

source_sentence: 王當為我得之，王若不得，我當死矣。』
translation: The king will get it for me, and if he doesn't get it, I'll die.'

source_sentence: 「王告夫人：『汝為且起，我作一國王，何所不得？』
translation: The king told his wife, 'Wait a minute, for I'll become the king of one country; what won't I get?'

source_sentence: 「王即便募於國中：『若有能得九色鹿者，當與分國治，賜其金鉢盛滿銀粟，
translation: The king then summoned the people of his country and said, 'If you can obtain a nine-colored deer, you must give it to the ruler of your state and give him a golden bowl full of silver corn.

source_sentence: 賜其銀鉢盛滿金粟。』
translation: He gave him a silver bowl full of golden grains.'

source_sentence: 「溺人聞王募重，心生惡念：『我說此鹿可得富貴，鹿是畜生，死活何在？』
translation: When the drowning man heard that the king was collecting heavily, he had a bad thought in his mind, 'I said this deer could attain wealth and prosperity, but the deer is an animal; where can I die and live?'

source_sentence: 便語募人言：『我知有九色鹿處。』
translation: He then said to the collector, 'I know there's a place for nine-colored deer.'

source_sentence: 「募人便將至王所言：『此人知有九色鹿處。』
translation: The gathering people then went to the king and said, 'That person knows there's a place for nine-colored deer.'

source_sentence: 「王聞大歡喜，王言：『汝得其皮角來，報之半國。』
translation: When the king heard this, he rejoiced greatly and said, 'The king said, 'Get me a horn of skin that comes from you, and I'll reward half a kingdom for it.'

source_sentence: 「於是，溺人面上即生癩瘡。
translation: “Thereupon, a leprosy sores appeared on the face of the drowning man.

source_sentence: 溺人言：『此鹿雖是畜生，大有威神，王宜多將人兵，乃可得耳。』
translation: The drowning man said, 'Even though this deer is an animal, it's greatly powerful and mighty; it's better for the king to have many men and armies, so he can get them.'

source_sentence: 「王即大出人兵往恒水邊。
translation: “The king immediately sent his men and soldiers to the edge of the Ganges River.

source_sentence: 烏在樹上遙見王人眾來，疑當殺鹿，即呼鹿言：『且起！
translation: The crow was on a tree and saw the king's people coming from a distance, suspecting that they were about to kill the deer, so he called out to the deer, 'Get up!'

source_sentence: 王來取汝。』
translation: The king came to take you.'

source_sentence: 鹿故熟臥不覺，烏復言：『知識且起。
translation: When the deer was old and lying unconscious, the crow again said, 'Get up, you know!'

source_sentence: 王將兵至。』
translation: The king's general arrives with his troops.'

source_sentence: 鹿故復不覺，烏便下樹，居其頭上、啄其耳：『知識且起！
translation: Again, the deer didn't realize it, so the crow went down to a tree, stood on top of its head, and pecked at its ears, 'Get up, you know!'

source_sentence: 王兵圍汝數重。』
translation: The king's army surrounded you several times.'

source_sentence: 「鹿方驚起，四顧望視，無復走地，便往趣王車邊。
translation: “Then the deer got up in fear and looked around in all directions to see. Without leaving the ground, he went to the side of the king’s carriage.

source_sentence: 傍人引弓欲射之，王告：『莫射此鹿，此鹿非常，將是天神耶！』
translation: The attendants drew their bow and wanted to shoot it, but the king told them, 'Don't shoot this deer; isn't this deer a heavenly god?'

source_sentence: 鹿即言：『莫射殺我，假我須臾，我有恩於國。』
translation: The deer then said, 'Don't shoot and kill me; if you grant me a moment of time, I'll be blessed by the kingdom.'

source_sentence: 王問：『有何恩？』
translation: The king asked, 'What's the kindness?'

source_sentence: 『我曾活王國中一人。』
translation: 'I once lived in the kingdom of one person.'

source_sentence: 即長跪，重問王：『誰道我在此？』
translation: He knelt down and asked the king again, 'Who told me to be here?'

source_sentence: 王言：『車邊癩面人也。』
translation: The king said, 'That's a leprosy-faced man by the side of the chariot.'

source_sentence: 「鹿舉頭看此人，眼中淚出，不能自勝：『大王！
translation: When the deer raised its head to look at this man, tears came out of their eyes and they couldn't control themselves, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 此人本溺在水中，隨流來下，或出或沒，得著樹木，仰頭呼天：「山神、樹神、諸天龍神，
translation: This man, who was originally submerged in the water, came down and went along with the river. Either going out or going down, he got hold of a tree and raised his head to call out to the gods: “The gods of the mountain,

source_sentence: 何不愍傷我？」
translation: Why don't you pity me?

source_sentence: 我時不惜此命，自投水中，負此人出，本要誓不相道；
translation: At that time I did not spare my life, but threw myself into the water and carried this man out. Originally I vowed not to tell you anything.

source_sentence: 人無反覆，不如水中浮木也。』
translation: People have no antidote, which is not like floating wood in water.'

source_sentence: 「王聞鹿言，有慙愧色：『我民無義。』
translation: When the king heard the deer say this, he had a shameful look of shame and said, 'My people have no meaning.'

source_sentence: 王即三教其民：『奈何！
translation: The king then instructed his people three times, 'Nai!

source_sentence: 奈何！
translation: Naked!

source_sentence: 受恩反欲殺之？』
translation: Do you want to kill him because you're grateful?'

source_sentence: 王即放鹿使去：『下國中，若有驅逐此鹿者，當誅汝五屬。』
translation: The king then released the deer messenger and departed, saying, 'If you drive this deer away from your country, you'll be punished by killing your five relatives.'

source_sentence: 於是，王便還宮。
translation: The king then returned to his palace.

source_sentence: 鹿歸故處。
translation: The deer returned to their old place.

source_sentence: 「是時，國中眾鹿皆來依附，數千為群，永不見害，共飲食水草，不犯人菜穀；
translation: At that time, all the deer in the kingdom came to rely on him. Hundreds of thousands became herds and never saw any harm done to them. They shared food, water, or grass; they did not violate the law against eating human

source_sentence: 從是之後，風雨以時，五穀豐熟，民無疾病，其時太平，畢命化去。」
translation: From then on, when the wind and rain were present, the five grains were abundant and the people didn't suffer from illness, and at that time Taihei left after his life was over.

source_sentence: 佛告諸弟子：「菩薩所行，雖處畜生不捨於慈，人獸竝度。
translation: The Buddha told his disciples, Although the bodhisattva's practice is to live among animals, he doesn't abandon kindness, and humans and animals are cruelly liberated.

source_sentence: 「是時夫人者，孫陀利是也；
translation: “The lady of that time was Sundarī.

source_sentence: 是時烏者，阿難是也；
translation: The crow at that time was Ānanda.

source_sentence: 是溺人者，調達是也；
translation: This is the person who drowns, and this is Sadāparvata.

source_sentence: 時鹿者，我身是也。
translation: The deer at the time was me.

source_sentence: 調達與我世世有怨；
translation: World-Honored One, the tamer has enemies from generation to generation with me.

source_sentence: 阿難有至意得道。」
translation: Ānanda has the supreme intention to attain enlightenment.

source_sentence: 菩薩更勤苦行波羅蜜，忍辱如是。
translation: The bodhisattva further exerted himself in the ascetic practice of the perfection of forbearance like this.

source_sentence: 佛說九色鹿經
translation: Foshuo nine-colored deer jing
